intro: Erigeron nabidshonii, commonly known as Nabidshon's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron nabidshonii is often found in open areas with limited vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
